get.description: List payment transactions and filter by parameters

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description:
Search by transaction_id.

Separate multiple transaction_id's with a comma.

Example: "8766546353263, 865756353537"

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description:
Search for transactions beginning on a particular date. 

Format date as a mm/dd/yy string.

Example: "01/01/18"

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description:
Search for transactions ending on a particular date.

Format date as a mm/dd/yy string.

Example: "04/01/18"

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description:
A case-sensitive string to return transactions by specific payment type type.

* cc = Credit Card transactions
* ach = ACH Transactions

You can return both cc and ach transactions by separating the values with a comma.

Example: "cc, ach"

parameters.name: trxn_status
parameters.description:
A case-sensitive string to return transactions by specific status type

* `approved` = Approved transactions
* `declined` = Declined transactions

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description:
Search for a specific amount. 

Use whole numbers and up to two decimals as necessary.

* Example: $12.00 = `"12"` or `12.0` or `"12.00"`
* Example: $18.40 = `18.4` or `"18.40"`
* Example: $48.98 = `"48.98"`

parameters.name: amount_from
parameters.description:
Search for a "from amount" to return all transactions equal to or greater than value entered. 

Use whole numbers and up to two decimals as necessary.

* Example: $12.00 = `"12"` or `12.0` or `"12.00"`
* Example: $18.40 = `18.4` or `"18.40"`
* Example: $48.98 = `"48.98"`

parameters.name: cardholder_name
parameters.description:
Case sensitive string search for transactions by name on credit card. Partial matches will be returned.

EXAMPLE:  sending `Jer` will return transactions with `cardholder_name` Jerry Simms and also Brenda Jerkins

parameters.name: card_brand
parameters.description:
Case sensitive string search for transactions by card brand. 

Valid values are:
* `visa`
* `mastercard`
* `amex`
* `discover`
* `jcb`
* `diners``

You can return multiple specific card brand combinations by separating the card brand names with a comma.

* Example: `"visa, amex"`

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description:
Case sensitive string search for transactions by `order_id`. 

You can return multiple transactions by separating the order_id with a comma.

* Example: `"abc-1277645, abc-1387665"`

parameters.name: first_6
parameters.description:
Search for transactions matching the first 6 digits of credit card account numbers. 

You can return multiple transactions by separating the first_6 with a comma.

* Example: `"545454, 454847"`

parameters.name: last_4
parameters.description:
Search for transactions matching the last 4 digits of credit card account numbers. 

You can return multiple transactions by separating the last_4 with a comma.

Example: `"4766, 1287"`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The number of results to return when viewing a page. 

The default limit is 40

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
The number of results to skip before returning results. 

The default offset is 0

parameters.name: cust_id
parameters.description:
Search for customer by `id`.  Separate multiple id filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:**  `635, 732`

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by first name.  Separate multiple first_name filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:** `"James, Sally, Mitch"`

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by last name.  Separate multiple last_name filters with a `,` (comma). 

**Example:** `"Brown, O'Brein, Contenelli"`

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by street address.  Partial input allowed.  

**Example:** `Main` will return all customers that have **Main** in their street address.

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by second street address.  Partial input allowed.  

**Example:** `Apt` will return all customers that have **Apt** in their secondary street address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by city name.  Separate multiple city name filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:** `"Los Angeles, Miami, Lake Arrowhead"`

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by ISO 2-digit state code.  Separate multiple state code filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example, `"CA, MN, GA"`

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: customer address zip code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by ISO 2-digit country code.  Separate multiple country code filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:** `"US, CA, RD"`

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by email address.  Partial input allowed.  For example, `example.com` will return all customers that have **example.com** in their email address. Separate multiple email filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:**  `"example.com, sally@company.com, .net"`

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by phone number.  Partial input allowed.  

**Example:** `213` will return all customers that have **213** in their phone number

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by company name.  Partial matches provided. For example, `bro` will return all customers that have **bro** in their their company name.  Separate multiple company_name filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:** `"bro, Acme Plumbing, Hatfield & McCoy"`

parameters.name: web_address
parameters.description:
Case-insensitive search for customers by website address.  Partial matches provided. For example, `jan` will return all customers that have **jan** in their their website address.  Separate multiple web_address filters with a `,` (comma).  

**Example:** `"jan, example.com"`

Electronic Commerce Indicator
`0` = Payment has been flagged as SSL secured transaction

`2` = Payment has been flagged as SSL 3-D Secure authentication transaction (cardholder not enrolled or partial authenticated)
